CVE.summary: The swiotlb functionality in the r8169 driver in drivers/net/r8169.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.27.22 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (IOMMU space exhaustion and system crash) by using jumbo frames for a large amount of network traffic, as demonstrated by a flood ping.

vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

Oval.title: RHSA-2009:1548 -- kernel security and bug fix update (Important)
DSA-1928 linux-2.6.24 -- privilege escalation/denial of service/sensitive memory leak
DSA-1915 linux-2.6 -- privilege escalation/denial of service/sensitive memory leak
ELSA-2009:1548: kernel security and bug fix update (Important)
DSA-1928-1 linux-2.6.24 -- privilege escalation/denial of service/sensitive memory leak
DSA-1915-1 linux-2.6 -- privilege escalation/denial of service/sensitive memory leak

The swiotlb functionality in the r8169 driver in drivers/net/r8169.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.27.22 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (IOMMU space exhaustion and system crash) by using jumbo frames for a large amount of network traffic, as demonstrated by a flood ping.
Linux Kernel '/drivers/net/r8169.c' Out-of-IOMMU Error Local Denial of Service Vulnerability
